title: Executive Order 5192-Abolishing Lewiston, New York, as a Customs Port of Entry
content: By virtue of the authority vested in me by the Act of Congress approved August 1, 1914, Lewiston, New York, is hereby abolished as a port of entry in Customs Collection District No. 9 (Buffalo) with headquarters at Buffalo, New York, effective thirty days from the date of this order.
citation: Herbert Hoover, Executive Order 5192-Abolishing Lewiston, New York, as a Customs Port of Entry Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/360890
